android.gameengine.icadroids.objects.collisions

Class CollidingObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.gameengine.icadroids.objects.collisions.CollidingObject

  • public class CollidingObject
extends java.lang.Object
    CollidingObject holds methods to calculate tile collisions. It's also the class that calls the collisionOccured() method.
    Author:
    Bas van der Zandt

                     int yPosition,
                     GameTiles gameTiles)
        Get a tile on a specific x and y position in the game world
        Parameters:
        xPosition - x position of the tile
        yPosition - y position of the tile
        gameTiles -
        Returns:
        The Tile object at the given x and y position

      • calculateCollision

        public void calculateCollision(double startX,
                      double startY,
                      double endX,
                      double endY,
                      Sprite sprite,
                      GameTiles gameTiles,
                      ICollision collisionObject)
        This method is automatically called by a MoveableGameObject This method calculates if there has been an collision when the object has moved. It calculates its collision by adding a collision box around it. This collision box includes it's current position and it's next position. This has the benefit that, when a object travels very fast, it will not pass through the tile. This method will call collisionOccurred();
        Parameters:
        startX - The current x position of the object
        startY - The current y position of the object
        endX - The next x position of the object
        endY - The next y position of the object
        sprite - The sprite of the object
        gameTiles - The gameTiles object to check the collision with
        collisionObject - An ICollision object that needs to be called when a collision has occurred

      • createCollisionAABB

        private Rect createCollisionAABB(double startX,
                       double startY,
                       double endX,
                       double endY,
                       Sprite sprite)
        Create a collision AABB box
        Parameters:
        startX - Start x position of the object
        startY - Start y position of the object
        endX - End x position of the object
        endY - End y position of the object
        sprite - The sprite of the object
        Returns:
        An collision AABB box

      • calculateCollisionAngle

        public double calculateCollisionAngle(double startX,
                             double startY,
                             Tile tile,
                             Sprite sprite)
        Calculates the angle between an object and a tile
        Parameters:
        startX - X position of the object
        startY - Y position of the object
        tile - A tile
        sprite - The sprite of the object. When the object has no sprite, use null
        Returns:
        The angle between the object and the tile

      • findTilesAt

        public final java.util.List<Tile> findTilesAt(Rect rectangle,
                               boolean returnInvisible,
                               GameTiles gameTiles)
        This function should finds tiles inside a given rectangle
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the rectangle specified in a left, top to bottom,right location
        returnInvisible - When true, the tiles that have tiletypes lower than 0 will be included.
        Returns:
        the list of tile objects found at the location. The size is zero when nothing is found.
